FuncDef:
The prefec-tca command configures an alarm threshold for FEC bit error ratio detection.
The undo prefec-tca command restores the default configuration for FEC bit error ratio detection.
By default, FEC bit error ratio detection is enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an alarm association threshold, where:
trigger-power: power of the alarm association threshold for an FEC bit error ratio, that is y in xE-y.
trigger-power: The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8.

Specifies an alarm clearing threshold, where:
recover-coefficient: coefficient of the alarm clearing threshold for an FEC bit error ratio, that is x in xE-y.
recover-coefficient: The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 999.  During calculation, the value is divided by 100.

Specifies an alarm clearing threshold, where:
recover-power: power of the alarm clearing threshold for an FEC bit error ratio, that is y in xE-y.
recover-power: The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9.

Indicates FEC bit error ratio detection.

trigger-coefficient: The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 999.  During calculation, the value is divided by 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure an alarm threshold for FEC bit error ratio detection, run the prefec-tca command. By default, FEC bit error ratio detection is enabled. The default alarm thresholds and detection intervals are used. If the FEC bit error ratio exceeds a specified threshold, the device reports an FEC bit error ratio alarm to the NMS. When the FEC bit error ratio falls below a specified threshold, the device reports an FEC bit error ratio clear alarm to the NMS.
